bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 161, Number 2 (Wednesday, January 7, 2015)]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. TURNER:H.R. 202.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8, Clauses 1 and 18; and Article IV,Section 3, Clause 2 of the Constitution of the United States.[Page H105]

item.title: A bill to amend the Dayton Aviation Heritage Preservation Act of 1992 to rename a site of the Dayton Aviation Heritage National Historical Park.

latestAction.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 621.

item.title: National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2017

latestAction.text: Received in the Senate. Read twice. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 502.

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Federal Lands.
Referred to the House Committee on Natural Resources.

summary.text: Amends the Dayton Aviation Heritage Preservation Act of 1992 to rename the John W. Berry, Sr. Wright Brothers Aviation Center, part of the Dayton Aviation Heritage National Historical Park in Dayton, Ohio, as the "John W. Berry, Sr. Wright Brothers National Museum."

bill.title: To amend the Dayton Aviation Heritage Preservation Act of 1992 to rename a site of the park.

item.title: To amend the Dayton Aviation Heritage Preservation Act of 1992 to rename a site of the park.
To amend the Dayton Aviation Heritage Preservation Act of 1992 to rename a site of the park.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
